results.title: The Merry wives of Windsor
results.creator_credit: David Jones, Shaun Sutton and BBC
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “BBC Television Shakespeare Series”.
Adaptation of one of Shakespeare’s comedies. Falstaff in love, attempts to woo two wealthy burgesses of Windsor, whom in turn, resolve to trick him with all their female weaponry. A colourful, eccentric comedy featuring an excellent cast starring Richard Griffiths as Falstaff, Alan Bennett as Judge Shallow, Ben Kingsley as Frank Ford, and Judy Davis and Prunella Scales as Mistresses Ford and Page.

results.title: King Lear (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Jonathan Miller, Shaun Sutton and BBC
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “BBC Television Shakespeare Series”.
This production of Shakespeare’s great play features Michael Hordern as King Lear, Michael Kitchen as Edmund, and Frank Middlemass as the Fool. “King Lear” is a tragedy that repeatedly portrays the restless intolerance of the young towards the old, the powerlessness of virtue in the face of deceit, and the fragility of the bonds which hold families and communities together. The production features an excellent Shakespearian cast.

results.title: Twelfth Night (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: John Gorrie, Cedric Messina and BBC
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “BBC Television Shakespeare Series”.
Featuring Felicity Kendall as Viola, this is a production of Shakespeare’s comedy of magic, romantic deception and foolish love. The film features a talented cast and remains faithful to the original text.

results.title: Henry IV. Part 1 (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: David Giles, Cedric Messina and BBC
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “BBC Television Shakespeare Series”.
Featuring Jon Finch as King Henry IV, David Gwillim as Prince Hal, Anthony Quayle as Falstaff. Shakespeare’s play is the dark portrait of a king who comes to the throne with blood on his hands. Having killed Richard III, he is guilt ridden by the knowledge of his foul deed. A usurper himself he is now being plotted against by those who helped him to power.

results.title: All's Well that Ends Well
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “BBC Television Shakespeare Series”.
Central to this story is the love of Helena, orphaned daughter of a celebrated physician, for Bertram, son of Countess Rousilon in whose house she has been brought up. Through the Countess’ skill the King allows Helena to marry Bertram but he, considering this an unfair alliance after pledging his vows, rejects Helena and leaves for Florence stipulating seemingly impossible tasks for her to fulfil for him to return. Through a daring plot Helena fulfils his conditions, saves Bertram from arrest and is reunited in marital harmony.

results.title: Much Ado about Nothing
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “BBC Television Shakespeare Series”.
A comedy with two main plots. One concerns the love affair between Beatrice and Benedict, the other deals with the conspiracy against Claudio who is engaged to Beatrice’s gentle cousin, Hero. Don John, who hates Claudio stages a pretended assignation between Borachio, one of his followers, and Margaret, Hero’s maid, who is garbed as her mistress. Claudio, who witnesses the scene and suspects Hero’s virtue, rejects his bride at the altar, but the matter is finally cleared up, with the help of the good Friar Francis.

results.title: Antony and Cleopatra
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “BBC Television Shakespeare Series”.
Mark Antony and Cleopatra have been enjoying a life of sensual pleasure. Hearing of his wife’s death and of an attack on Italy, Mark Antony returns to Rome where he resolves the differences existing between himself and the other triumvires, Octavius Caesar and Lepidus, by marrying Octavius’ sister, Octavia. However, when Mark Antony succumbs to Cleopatra’s enticements once again, and returns to Egypt, Octavius seizes upon this insult to his sister as a pretext for attacking his erstwhile ally.

results.title: Hamlet (BBC)
results.creator_credit: Rodney Bennett, Cedric Messina, BBC and Time-Life Television
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “BBC Television Shakespeare Series”.
Hamlet, Prince of Denmark, falls into melancholia after the death of his father, the king. Claudius, his father’s brother, has assumed the throne and married Hamlet’s mother, Gertrude, within two months of the king’s death. The king’s ghost appears to his son, denounces Claudius for the murderer he is, and demands revenge. Hamlet pretends madness in order to avenge his father’s death. Ophelia’s rejection of his suit provides a plausible reason for this display of madness. Overcome by doubts about the validity of the king’s accusation Hamlet persuades some travelling players to re-enact the death of the king, eventually exposing Claudius as a murderer.

results.title: The Tempest
results.creator_credit: John Gorrie, Cedric Messina, BBC and Time-Life Television
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “BBC Television Shakespeare Series”.
Featuring Michael Horden as Prospero, David Dixon as Ariel, Pippa Guard as Miranda, Warren Clarke as Caliban. Shakespeare’s play is about disposed Duke Prospero whose brother illegally takes over the Dukedom while exiling Prospero with his baby daughter, Miranda. Put to sea they find a haven on an island and live there for years until fate lands the brother and his attendants on the island. Eventually Prospero’s name and rights are restored to him.

results.title: A Midsummer night's dream (BBC)
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “BBC Television Shakespeare Series”.
Shakespeare’s famous fantasy drama featuring Helen Mirren as Titania, Peter McEnery as Oberon, and Nigel Davenport as Theseus. No other credits available.
